intro: Noticastrum calendulaceum, commonly known as the yellow thornapple, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, yellow-orange flowers and spiny, lobed leaves. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hairy seeds. Noticastrum calendulaceum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
